result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dale R. Delaney

records.addlTxt: Status conference on November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conf adj from 10/19 to 11/10 @ 8:30am on court's own motion; court unavailable on previously scheduled date

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Young.  Clerk. M.Burke.  State in victim rights compliance. Attorney Young states that she has received an offer but she has received a letter from the victim and states that the victim and the state need to talk further. STC set to 10/19/22 at 9:00.

Defendant Dale R. Delaney appeared with Attorney Toni L. Young.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  Case heard with 22CF582 today.  Not guilty plea entered. DE motion to modify bond; arguments heard; Court modifies bond to $100 signature bond with same conditions (see bond event).  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED. NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM
*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol. *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription. No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Festival Foods in Kenosha County. Sarah N. or William M.

01:16 PM    Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Toni Young.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Referred to Intake for Further proceedings scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 09:15 am.   Bond continued with same conditions as previously set. (see previous bond entry). rb

records.addlTxt:

MINUTES: 22CF582/22CM548. SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE in Case 22CF582. This case continues to trail. Bond continued. Status conference scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Festival Foods in Kenosha County, Sarah N, or William M.

The Court finds probable cause in this case today. Plea of Not Guilty entered. Referred to Intake for Further proceedings scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 10:00 am w/ 22CF582.  $100  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  sg
